Package support

Interface AppContext

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Main
    public interface AppContext
    Interface providing access to application-wide resources and values. The application has a single implementation of this interface, which it passes to each controller via setContext() to configure the controller.

    The AppContext is the gate guard for the logged-in user. A logged-in user can only be assigned via a successful call to login(), and it can only be retrieved via getUser(), preventing the rest of the application from accidentally subverting what would otherwise have to be convention.

    The app takes this approach rather than using static class members because this approach supports mock injection for testing. We did not have a requirement to create tests for this app, but I thought it important to demonstrate maintainable structure for future reference.

    Author:
    Joseph T. Lapp
    See Also:
    Controller.setContext(support.AppContext)

      • login

        boolean login​(java.lang.String username,
              java.lang.String password)
       throws DatabaseException
        Attempts to log the user into the application. Does so by looking for the provided username and password in the database.
        Parameters:
        username - Username credential
        password - Password credential
        Returns:
        true when the user was successfully logged in
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - on database error

      • logoutAndLogin

        void logoutAndLogin​(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
        Logs the current user out of the application, if a user is logged in, and opens a new login window that asks for credentials.
        Parameters:
        stage - Stage on which to open the window
